== What happened between 1970 and now? ==
The final line of the article remarks that she was still visible as late as 1970, what happened between then and now that she is no longer visible today?[[User:Yoenit|Yoenit]] ([[User talk:Yoenit|talk]]) 09:23, 9 April 2010 (UTC)
:She may still be there; I haven't been able to find anything about the ship post-1970 (Groner's book was [http://www.worldcat.org/title/deutschen-kriegsschiffe-1815-1945/oclc/223587568&referer=brief_results originally published in 1966] and updated subsequently by the editors). [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 14:12, 12 April 2010 (UTC)
::The German version of this article states, in the final sentence of the ship's history, that still in 1980 there were remnants to be seen, which were "broken off" in the following years. I'm not a native speaker and can't determine whether there's any implication that this breaking off was done by wind and weather, or by people, but the suggestion is that nothing remains to be seen. [[User:Laanders|Laanders]] ([[User talk:Laanders|talk]]) 14:22, 21 August 2015 (UTC)
{{Talk:SMS Schlesien/GA1}}
== Mixed up ==
I changed the Staff references according to what the source actually says. Who ever entered the data simply looked in the wrong column. [[User:ÄDA - DÄP|ÄDA - DÄP VA]] ([[User talk:ÄDA - DÄP|talk]]) 18:42, 28 May 2013 (UTC) :Thanks for fixing that. [[User:Parsecboy|Parsecboy]] ([[User talk:Parsecboy|talk]]) 18:45, 28 May 2013 (UTC)
